name: Bo Jackson Baseball
description:
Bo Jackson was the first all-star athlete in two major sports, Baseball and American Football. Bo Jackson Baseball is a game about Bo Jackson baseball career. This game plays lake a standard baseball nine (or 5 – 8 if you wish) innings baseball game. There are three difficulty levels giving access to players at all still levels. When pitching you are given 5 different pitch types that pitcher chooses by pressing the correct directional button before the pitch, therefore keeping it hidden from your opponent. Batting is done the same way but the type of hit is chosen as the batter hits the ball.

At any moment, base sneaking can be made (by the batter) or stopped (by the pitcher). Fielding is only done using the CPU, but once the fielder gets the ball then you must choose what base to throw to using the directional buttons. All of the teams are just city names and players, all with different stats, are fictional except for Bo Jackson himself who is hidden in the game.

shot.caption: Copyright screen
Title screen
Options screen
Game settings screen. Set things like difficulty (Little League, Big League, All Star), visual, and sound.
When starting a new game the player must select there own and the computers teams.
Select the team batting line up or just leave it as is.
At the start of the baseball game this woman sings the US national anthem, well at least moves her lips as the tune plays in the background.
Left side shows all the five different pitches the pitcher can do. Just need to press the correct direction on the D-pad.
The ball been pitched …
… and it was a strike. This is accompanied by audio saying ‘Strike’.
The next shot was a good hit. For the record the man running for the ball missed and it hit the back wall.
Every time the runner gets run out by a close margin it shows this screen accompanied by the audio saying ‘He was safe by a mile’ ‘Your out’ ‘He was safe’ ‘Your out’.
The runner always goes out after that cut screen.

The batting screen shows the all the five different hits you can do on the right side.  Just need to press the correct direction on the D-pad as the batter hits the ball. Default view in 2 player mode
Batter getting ready to hit the ball …
… and it was a ball. This is accompanied by audio saying ‘Ball’.
Foul!
A home run (the ball is in that crowd somewhere).
Animation on the score board is displayed after the home run.
The scores at the end of the game
The trophy is handed over by Bo Jackson himself.
The team also gets a mention on the sports paper. (Note the Data East self-promotion)
This is the way the Play Off’s work. The ‘NES vs NES Quick’ just shows the final scores the rest of the options plays like a normal game.
